Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.fra.dot.gov/Elib/Document/282

Description: A consent agreement and compliance order between the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and Koppers, Inc. will prevent the release of thousands of pounds of uncontrolled emissions of hazardous air pollutants from the Follansbee, W.Va. coal tar refining facility annually. The agreements require Koppers to install new equipment, conduct additional monitoring and pay a penalty of $75,000 for alleged violations of Clean Air Act requirements controlling emissions of hazardous air pollutants.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/c857a19e88bb4e8485257a140060c167.html

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.fra.dot.gov/Elib/Document/282

Description: Koppers agreed to pay a penalty of $2.9 million to resolve allegations of numerous violations of several environmental regulations at many of the company's U.S. facilities and committed to carry out an environmental management system.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2003/January/03_enrd_022.htm
